boardgame.name: Dale of Merchants: Update Pack
boardgame.description:
Dale of Merchants Collection introduced a few card effects that can create problems when used in combination with certain cards from the first two games in the series as well as the Systematic Eurasian Beavers mini-expansion.

To address this, the publisher created this update pack which includes updated versions of those cards to replace the old ones.

New printings will include these updated cards instead of the old versions.


Game versions affected

Any Dale of Merchants games printed in 2019 or later will include the updated cards by default. Games older than that have the original cards and their version numbers are listed below. You can find the version number of your game at the back of the game box near the bar code (or on the card with the bar code in case of the Beaver expansion).

Dale of Merchants versions affected: SWG150101, SWG160102, SWG170103

Dale of Merchants 2 versions affected: SWG160201, SWG170202

Systematic Eurasian Beavers mini expansion version affected: SWG160301

If you own one or more games with the old versions of the cards, you can order the update pack from the publisher's online store. The pack itself is free so you can purchase it by paying only for the shipping. Alternatively, you can add the pack to your order while you purchase something else. Please note that while the update pack is always beneficial, it isn’t absolutely needed unless you plan to combine your game with Dale of Merchants Collection.


Cards included in the update pack, sorted by game

Dale of Merchants:

Dealing Giant Pandas 3 – Essential Purchase
Thieving Northern Raccoons 2 – Nuisance
Hoarding Flying Squirrels 3 – Nostalgic Item
Hoarding Flying Squirrels 4 – Acorn
Lucky Ocelots 5 – Blindfold


Dale of Merchants 2:

Diligent Pale-throated Sloths 3 – Housecleaning
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 1 – Little Villain
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 2 – Scary Gunfight
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 5 – Nasty Threat
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 5 – Lost Shipments
Observant Snowy Owls 5 – Balancing


Systematic Eurasian Beavers mini expansion:

Systematic Eurasian Beavers 5 – Practice



Patch notes - Why the cards were changed

New term, opponent

All instances of “other players” were replaced with “opponents” to streamline team rules. Now there are no exceptions on how the card texts should be read no matter if you’re playing with the team rules or not.

Affected cards:

Lucky Ocelots 5 – Blindfold
Hoarding Flying Squirrels 4 – Acorn
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 1 – Little Villain
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 2 – Scary Gunfight
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 5 – Nasty Threat
Intimidating Dwarf Crocodiles 5 – Lost Shipments


Effects affecting all junk

Some cards had effects affecting “all junk cards” from various places. Those were restricted to 3 because of the Swindling Black-headed Gulls in the Dale of Merchants Collection. As Gulls gift junk to other players, the maximum number of junk those effects could have affected was larger than desired. The effects remain mostly the same without Gulls.

Affected cards:

Dealing Giant Pandas 3 – Essential Purchase
Diligent Pale-throated Sloths 3 – Housecleaning


Less discarding with 4 players

Nuisance (Raccoons 2) was a bit too disruptive with 4 players when it discarded a card from all opponents. Now it discards only from up to 2 other players. You can still target two leading players so the function of the cards remains mainly unchanged while slowing the game down a bit less.

Affected cards:

Thieving Northern Raccoons 2 – Nuisance


Text clarity

As there are new card types in Dale of Merchants Collection, some cards needed a bit of updating to make them work great with those. Also, Practice (Beavers 5) had an error in the old text where you could permanently remove cards from an opponent’s stall with an Acorn which was never intended.

Affected cards:

Hoarding Flying Squirrels 3 – Nostalgic Item
Observant Snowy Owls 5 – Balancing
Systematic Eurasian Beavers 5 – Practice

boardgame.name: Aces Up: WWI Fighter Combat
boardgame.description:
Aces Up – WWI Fighter Combat is a fast play card game that recreates the Dogfights of World War 1.

The game is easy to play, but tough to master.
Luck will play its part, but the decisions you’ll make are more important.

Knowing when to Head Home, use your Bonus Dice, or when to go Purely Defensive, can be the difference between gaining Fame & Glory or ending up in a smoking death spiral.

And the nice thing is; no two Missions (games) will ever play exactly the same.

Totally playable solo with rules for a Campaign with a simple way to gauge how well, or bad, you’re doing!

—description from the publisher

The Witch Trial does away with the jury and is instead lead by an angry mob who is ready to hang anybody they believe is a witch.
